+atk -spd Berkut's Lance (+res refinement) Reposition Bonfire/Ignis DC QR Threaten defense/attack Distant Defense/Deflect Missle This makes him a great overall tank and even mage killer. Merges transfer, but inheritence doesn't. As a matter of fact, don't even enhance a weapon at all if you want someone else to inherit it. Just have the inheriter be the one to refine it.

Mine is currently +atk -res, so I'm waiting for one that is -spd. Currently his atk is 53, spd 22, def 38, and res 17. Defense is 38, then add 2 for azura which, 2 for summoner support, and 1 or 2 for ally support which brings him to 43 or 44. Then add 6 if against bows or daggers. Also factor in threaten attack if you decide to go that route instead of threaten defense. Res goes up 7 when defending, and DD gives him another 6 on top of that, bringing it to 30 on defense phase. Bring Azura in with Drive res and her dance, that brings it up to 35. Add a summoner support, 37, and ally support is like 38 or 39 (I forget how much it boosts). And that's with a Res boon.

I currently don't have support on him because I'm still in the process of team building, but it will most likely be Azura or another support unit. He works amazingly, and will work even better when I can find one with better IVs. He laughs at a lot of mages just as much as he laughs at physical units. And thanks! Good to know.

WRITING.TITLE: Recommendation/Idea for summoning?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm sure it's been floated around a lot, but I think a good idea for those who are p2p would be like, for every $30 or $50 spent or whatever, you get a guaranteed hero of your choice from the banner you're pulling with neutral IVs. Could I answer, and then ask you a couple questions too? :) I don't speak Japanese so I'm unable to ask your community myself. 1: It depends, personally I'd only do that if I like a character from their original game. For example, I'd raise Alm and Hinoka over similar stronger characters because I love their art AND I love their characters in their games. From what I've seen, this holds true for a lot of people, but people who have never played other fire emblem games may just raise characters with good art in general. 2: A little less than I'd use loved characters. I'll raise a character if they're really good, but I wont make them among my best. Good stats help my teams, but I don't like using them because they might not be characters I know. For other people though, it seems that if a character has high stats, they will raise them regardless of whether or not they like the character in order to have a better team. 3: I think it's a cool idea, but they need to make them not as strong, and choose more characters than from Awakening and Fates. 4: I'm not a fan of Alfonse and Shareena, but I like Fjorm and Sutr. However, I don't care too much about them. I think they're cool, but they need more character development before I can care too much about them. As for my questions: 1: Which characters are the most popular in Japan? If you had to name the top 5 characters? 2: Are characters like Camilla popular in Japan? The ones that are more naked, even if they don't have a lot of personality? 3: Does voice acting affect how much you like a character? 4: Is Shadows of Valentia/Gaiden popular? And if so, which character is most popular from it? 5: Was your community angry about the way Ayra was released? And are they currently unhappy that Eirika was released with Knoll's tome? Or is that just us being whiny children? If you don't answer the questions it's fine, I know you have a ton of responses, but thanks!

After a few days of using both decks now, I can kind of pretend like I actually know what I'm talking about now. The Mach Strike deck is great, it's well rounded, definitely a solid choice. However, it can be a bit slow to start up at times. As for destruction fang, you can almost always apply pressure right from the start. Got salandit to start? You probably also got an ultra ball or some support card to help you bring out salazzle, so that's one energy card to provide 80 damage per turn. I win a lot of matches within 2 or 3 turns of starting just because of that alone. Hydreigon is also no joke, and more useful than garchomp imo based off raw power alone as well as type advantages against psychics. He can be a bit harder to bring out though since none of them have ascendence (or whatever move gible and gabite have to bring out garchomop). There is also no cynthia type card to make hydreigon's power double. But again, a good anti psychic deck. This deck also has a fighting weakness which can be a problem against mach strike, which as you said, 90% of people run. Luckily the deck revolves around garchomp who does not have a type advantage over dark. Overall, I much prefer destruction fang due to the constant pressure you can apply. Of course, there are garbage starting draws like any other deck that will just screw you over, but the chances of that happening in this deck are much lower than all the others. I've won several tournaments just based on this fact alone, and consistently beat other decks even with a weakness to fighting (unless they get lucky very early). I hope this helps! And isn't too late if you decided to invest in it.

For sure! I've entered 5 tournaments and have gotten in the bottom 2 once, 2nd 2 times and 1st 2 times. I highly recommend it, and you rarely have to face other DF since there are so many MS, which I mostly win because the early pressure keeps them from setting up too well, and even when they do, Hyreigon, Houndoom and Salazzle are beasts. Getting a bewear early is also ridiculous since he's basically an anti-basic pokemon, or oranguru for the evolved ones. Side note: How are all the others? I've only gotten MS and DF, but have been wanting to make either an electric, steel or dark expanded deck with fairy so I've been having a hard time deciding.

I would go Camilla, Hinoka, Azura and Caeda. Camilla is a no brainer, one of the staples of a flier team, and with flier buffs, the -atk iv won't matter a whole ton (although if you have the opportunity, try to get a better one, literally any iv that isn't -atk is better. She's still a beast though). Cordelia is technically "better" because of her speed, but Hinoka's refinement makes her better imo with proper set up, just make sure to have desperation on her, and be careful on counters since she needs her lance to be better than Cordy compared to the Firesweep/Brave build. Azura is a no brainer, I'm not gonna even explain it. Just please do WoM instead of her natural B skill, fortify fliers should be run and gives a better boost. Both Palla and Caeda are pretty meh, and Cordelia is still meh even with her new weapon, but it does make her better than Palla and gives her a specialty on your team, especially because cavs can still be a pain, and hector is still not fun to deal with, especially for flier teams. She solos hector which is her biggest thing, and kills a lot of cavs that aren't too tanky. I used her mainly as support and anti-hector and she worked great. Give her fortify fliers and she's good to go. I would wait for a better IV since she's 4 stars. You can either raise Palla without full investment to wait, or fully invest in Caeda and then just merge when you get a better one. With all of this said, if you get the chance to get H!Nowi, please do. I was questioning getting her before and not just waiting for a S!Camilla rerun, but she's crazy good with a bladetome, and easily the most useful red. Cherche is a really good replacement for green if you don't want to run double blade tome, and Minerva is good as well (I personally prefer Cherche for waifu reasons and her monster attack). She kills most things not red (but still does kill lowerish defense reds). Just run Brave Axe on her and she's a beast. I've had an evolving flier team since day 1 practically, so I can say all of this with experience (although never got S!Camilla and I feel I no longer need to).

WRITING.TITLE: My EP Sacred Stones Mixed Team Build and Breakdown
WRITING.TEXT: https://imgur.com/a/43EI3 It didn't start as a SS team, but it definitely ended that way when Myrrh was introduced. This is my very first team build post, soooo yeah. Not sure how that's relevant. But without further ado, here it is! **Tana: Winged Princess** *IVs*: +Def -Res *ALLY SUPPORT*: Innes/Summoner because ~~(waifu for laifu)~~ she benefits most from the buffs in my opinion as the lead physical tank on this team). *WEAPON*: Vidofnir Wait what happened to the firesweep/brave build? Pfft, who needs that with these fantastic IVs. Base 29 defense (+4 for supports) +7 on EP? Sign me up for that 40 defense before buffs and skills. The best offense is the best defense. Without Vidofnir, she becomes another Cordelia/Hinoka. Vidofnir is clearly the superior choice for a lance in my opinion, and I will fight any of you who say otherwise. *ASSIST*: Reposition Works great with her partner in crime Innes, as he can jump in front of her to tank/kill an enemy mage, then reposition him away afterwards to allow her to take physical damage. More Innes shenanigans later. *SPECIAL*: Bonfire Who doesn't want all of the extra damage that Bonfire can produce with her monstrous defense? Easily the best choice of a special here as it can add anywhere from 25-28 damage on enemy phase. All added defenses will be explained later. Can be switched for moonbow, but it's such a waste. Bonfire is really the only way to go. *A SKILL*: Atk/Def Bond Her two most important skills as a tank, and if she's always next to her brother, why not take advantage? This adds an additional and crucial +5 to both attack and defense, bringing her attack to 59 and defense up to 45 (from the value explained earlier). "What if Innes isn't there" some of you simple-minded fools might ask. The answer is he is ALWAYS there. "But what if---" HE IS ALWAYS THERE YOU AUDACIOUS ANTELOPE. But for the sake of argument, any unit can be thrown next to her for the +5 bonuses, she just loses out on the +2 to all stats from ally support. Can switch out for sturdy stance if needed as it's only a 1 stat point drop in attack and defense, but you lose any sort of player phase potential with that as it only applies on defense. *B SKILL*: Quick Riposte Tana is ~~lightning fast~~ meh at 36 base speed (40 after supports), which in today's meta, is enough to double slow tanky units, and enough to not get doubled by fast units. Throw QR on there and she doubles everyone while only getting doubled by a select few units and speed buffed teams. If they're physical, non-emerald axing and non-bowing, she walls all of them anyways. Can switch for lancebreaker or guard, but neither are nearly as successful as QR. *C SKILL*: Guidance "But you have reposition! Isn't that redundant??" Well let me drop a little knowledge on you you redundant kumquat. It's not. Because of Guidance, my units (especially Innes) can guide their pretty little faces to ~~have surprise coitus in the rectum~~ explode in enemy ranks, and then repositioned to safety behind the wall named Tana. Can switch for a tactic depending on your team comp (res tactic could potentially work great). *SACRED SEAL*: Close Defense Pretty much a given. Stacks with her weapon effect to bring her defense to 51 with supports and no buffs, and resistance to a respectable 30 against manaketes. ***OVERVIEW***: She's a beast. With her defensive buffs from her teammates (explained soon), she gets +6 defense, bringing her total defense to 57 defense as long as she has Innes next to her. That's enough to tank any sword, lance, or axe user in the game without an emerald axe for minimal damage (usually between 0-3 damage). She also struggles against the garbage called Los Angeles Hector because of the wrath effect of armads. Because of the importance of Close Defense, she does die quickly to bows as well, so be wary of those darn things. Recommended for EP teams? 15/10, need to have her. Questions? Concerns? Confused by my unnecessary amount of parenthesis? Good, let's continue. **Innes: Regal Strategician** *IVs*: +Atk -Spd (Great boon followed by a sad bane. Still works wonders). *ALLY SUPPORT*: You will never guess because I was so cryptic before this, but it's TANA! SURPRISE! *WEAPON*: Nidhogg "But-but guard bow for tanking! Or brave bow for damage! Or firesweep because I hate Faye and wanted her dead asap!" Well first off, Faye is somewhat kind of-ish bae as long as your name is Alm, so leave her alone. Second, his build does not work without Nidhogg. Just by being next to Tana, he gets +2 to all of his stats for ally support, and another +2 to all stats because of the weapon effect. Think of it as a second summoner support. It also stacks depending on how many units he has next to him. Having just Tana next to him brings his attack to 54, his speed to a more respectable but still meh 35, and his resistance to 35 as well. Add +2 to each of those with every unit next to him. *ASSIST*: Draw Back This is to protect Tana from ranged attacks, or to move Innes out of range of a physical attacker, so it has saved the sibling duo many times. *SPECIAL*: Iceberg Same reason as Tana's bonfire special. He can do anywhere from an additional 15-25 (usually 23 if just with Tana) damage based on skills and number of allies next to him. *A SKILL*: Atk/Res Bond Again, these are the most important stats for Innes for this build. Attack +5 next to Tana's support brings his attack to 59 (no way, same as Tana, such wow), and his resistance to 40. This is easily the best skill for his A slot, but is an extremely expensive skill. Fortress Res can be used as an alternate if you want him to remain an EP unit, or can be switched to mirror strike if going for a player phase. I'm sure mirror stance will be coming out sooner or later as well, and that can be used as a more reliable +4 atk/res. "But---" NO BUTTS I SAID THEY WILL ALWAYS BE TOGETHER YOU SULKING CENTIPEDE. *B Skill*: Quick Riposte Innes's speed, even without the speed boon, is meh at best. This remedies that and basically lets him kill all ranged units on retaliation that either don't kill him first (melts against brave bows and really anyone fast due to his super low defense), or aren't named H!Henry or Boey. Even then however, IVs and number of units adjacent to him can completely change that. Other than those however, he tanks and kills EVERY SINGLE MAGE IN THE GAME. This includes The Reinhardt. QR is essential for this, and cannot be switched. Guard has been considered, and that's it. Just considered. QR is too important. *C SKILL*: Def Tactic Remember how Tana got that random +6 defense buff at the end of her analysis? It comes from this guy. He does not need defense himself as he dies against the majority of physical attackers, but the benefits of him adding it to the rest of the team are astronomical, especially as an enemy phase team. I cannot recommend this skill enough for him. Attack ploy or drive defense are alternatives, but Def Tactic should be at the top of your priority list if building him for a mixed team. *SACRED SEAL*: Distant Defense Really goes without saying, it brings his resistance up to 45 against mages, and 20 against bows and daggers. Deflect magic can work here as well, but Distant defense is much more important for his magical tanking. ***OVERVIEW***: Also a beast... with support As long as Tana is next to him and he's tanking mages, there are very few units better than Innes. The colorless aspect adds to his versatility as he doesn't need to worry about certain colors ruining his viability. He can also take a hit from a bow or dagger, but that's it, one hit. Unfortunately a lot are built with brave bows or really high speeds, which make him almost useless against them. He does survive much more if you "stack the box" with units around him, so that is always an option as well. Another aspect I really like about Innes is that he can also be used as an offense phase unit to either finish units off, or to just outright kill them with his high attack with Iceberg. All of his buffs apply to both phases except for distant defense, so he has no issues attacking melees from afar and then hiding behind Tana afterwards. He ORKOs a loooot of units this way, so it's fun to mess around with! Recommended for EP teams? 9/10 with support, highly recommend/ 5/10 without support, could find someone better. **Joshua: Tempest King** *IVs*: Neutral af *ALLY SUPPORT*: Myrrh *WEAPON*: Audhulma Grants Res +5, has killer weapon effect, what't not to like? His somewhat low attack makes Brave weapons inadequate, he loses out on some key stats with a firesweep, not to mention his speed, while pretty good, doesn't justify a firesweep sword. Wo Dao could be good as well, but why invest in that when Audhulma is great as is, and gives him his own unique weapon. Wo Dao can be used on many other units. *ASSIST*: Reposition I feel I'm explaining these too much, so it's just great on teams. Not much else to say other than that. *SPECIAL*: Iceberg With his weapon effect, Joshua's resistance jumps up to 33, which slightly edges out his defense, which makes iceberg the better choice. Moonbow can also work very well, I just felt iceberg gave a better damage output, especially with the killer effect of his weapon. *A SKILL*: Distant Counter A Hector died on the battlefield. He just lost a bet, so now Joshua has his Distant Counter. With his naturally bulky defenses and decent speed, he is a perfect candidate for DC. He tanks mages well with his 33 res and decent HP, and hits back hard with Iceberg. He also takes physical attacks well, just not as well as magical. Fury also works great as his A skill because of his well-rounded stats. It also helps him get into wrath range, speaking of which... *B SKILL*: Wrath I cried when I gave this to him because this build makes him my most expensive unit to date, but it was well worth it. Combined with his weapon effect, when under 75% hp, he's basically always proccing Iceberg. So he goes from a decent mixed tank to a powerhouse who kills anyone he touches (as long as they're not blue). He is also able to do this on offense since his bulk does not come from enemy phase effects of his skills/weapons. So he needs to tank a hit to start, then he can be both player and enemy phase when below 75%. Vantage, guard or windsweep would all work here as well, but not nearly as effectively. *C SKILL*: Defense Ploy His resistance is solid, but his attack is meh. This helps remedy that by lowering their defenses, setting up THE ENEMY for him or his teammates to kill. *SACRED SEAL*: Quick Riposte Even though his speed is decent, that's it. It's *decent*. To help out with that and to help with his tanking ability, especially while he's still pre-wrath range, QR will usually KO characters that aren't blue due to his slaying and wrath effects. ***OVERVIEW*** At first glance, especially when compared to the defenses of Tana and Innes, Joshua seems very underwhelming. However, his DC and Wrath combo make him a beast to use, and don't forget that he also benefits from Innes's defense tactic if they're close enough. He also gets a boost from being near Myrrh, which just increases his defenses even further. Recommend for EP teams? 7/10, somewhat-highly recommend. **Myrrh: Great Dragon** *IVs*: (+spd -res, ouch. At least she's not -atk or -def, and her ridiculous BST still makes her an amazing unit despite these IVs). *ALLY SUPPORT*: Joshua *WEAPON*: Great Flame 19 might weapon, built-in non-armor enemy only wary fighter (ish depending on their defense), AND refined dragon effect without the added special cooldown? Holy shit if you aren't jumping for joy about having this weapon (or crying if going against it), you have some serious issues. Easily one of the best weapons in the game even without the built-in DC, which would just make it broken. Can replace with lightning breath I guess? But you're missing out on so much, and everyone going against you will probably judge you... forever. *ASSIST SKILL*: Reposition Yawn. Nothing special here, next. *SPECIAL*: Bonfire Without defense tactic adding to it, her defense sits at 36 (38 after ally support), which is quite bulky, and a considerable amount higher than her 28 (30 with support) res with a res bane. She already has strong attack, so adding bonfire on top of that just sends her attack to insane levels. Moonbow or glimmer can be used alternatively, with moonbow having the edge over the two. However, I feel you'd be missing out on so much damage if you switch. *A SKILL*: Distant Counter Her weapon doesn't come with DC, doesn't mean you can't throw it on her! She is easily one of the best DC users in the game, especially with her refined dragon effect. Everyone going against her will have to think twice before attacking her head on. She is also unable to have breath skills, which makes the decision for her A slot super easy. *B SKILL*: Quick Riposte Even with her +spd boon, her speed is... forgettable. She's being doubled by units with 34 or more speed, which is a lot of characters, especially red units who are able to obliterate her manakete...butt... So QR is taken to fix that as she should mainly be used on defense phase anyways. *C SKILL*: Atk Tactic So to start, I know she could use the +6 attack for herself, as 52 attack is pretty darn good, but could be better. However, remember that she is EP and gets the refined dragon effect, which powers her up a tooon (against ranged units). Joshua, Innes and Tana could all use the boost more than her to ensure their KOs. She could also work well with ploys (with different IVs) or smokes to help the entire team tank even better. *SACRED SEAL*: Iote's Shield We can't have our favorite flying manakete shot down by arrows can we? The flying unit part of her is great for terrain, but Iote's is almost necessary on her as her refined manakete weapon applies to ranged units. Guidance can work here as well to support the team even more, but may be redundant since Tana already has it, and Iote's is more important. ***OVERVIEW*** Myrrh is a beast. There's no other way to say it. She's the anchor/clean-up crew of the team as it seems she never dies. Her great mixed bulk, combined with her great weapon effect and strength makes her a force to be reckoned with. Recommended for an EP team? 9/10, highly recommend. ***OVERVIEW FOR THE TEAM*** I have each type of emblem team: Armor, Horse, Flying, and Infantry, and I have to say that this is easily my best team. They consistently win in arena and score between 698-706, which is higher than any of my other teams (I don't have extras to merge :(). The only drawback is that this team struggles in chain challenges because of it's lack of a healer (rip healer L'arachel), but who needs a healer when the entire team is taking no damage in the first place? Playing smart and with correct positions makes that extremely possible with this team. I'm really proud of it, and what better theme than Sacred Stones right?? Thanks for reading! I hope it makes any sense at all as this took forever to type up, and I'm open to answering questions about your units Tana/Innes/Joshua/Myrrh/Mixed teams as well to the best of my ability.

Neither, all units have their advantages and disadvantages. Tbh my best team is my flier team, and I have infantry, mixed, horse, armor, and dragon teams. You dont need those weapons or wrath to be successful.

Majority of fliers are definitely offense oriented, so I wouldn't think about sustain and more about Ohkos. My current team is H!Nowi, Cherche, Cordelia and NY!Azura, and I will say having hone fliers as well as a mage bladetome flier is essential. Nowi Ohkos everything she touches except super res tanky blues, and cherche comes in to clean them up. Neither are tanky but are insanely good player phase units. I'm personally not too big a fan of using L!Robin as her general stats are all around, but realistically not great. I like having units with a given role and sticking to it, not a one size fits all kind of character. And her attack is a bit on the lower side imo. Elincia is great, even better with db and hone fliers support. Just make sure she has hit and run so you can reposition her away. Hinoka is great as well, but I think bladetome mages do her job well enough with hone and fortify on them, I think hinoka works well on a non-flier team also, a mixed team would be great with her I've honestly never looked into Minerva since I dont have one so I dont have any feedback on her, but I like cherche! If shes anything like cherche, shes amazing. If you want tanky fliers, myrrh is definitely the way to go. I have her on a different team, and basically nothing except red kills her with qr, iotes and aether.

No probs :) for budget, I'd try to go cordelia or shigure (with brave or firesweep depending on what's available to you) elincia, and brave cherche or hauteclare minerva (since I dont know Minervas skillset) since they are all ridiculous player phase units, and make sure to throw galeforce on cordelia. Elincia if you're feeling ballsy, but I think moonbow works better on her and cherche. For last one you can probs go WF!Hinoka.

WRITING.TITLE: Glitch where Pokemon repeatedly break out of balls quickly?
WRITING.TEXT: So back during the spring equinox event, I had a 45 minute period where I would attempt to catch a Pokemon, the ball would not even finish shaking once and would break out, and the Pokemon would run away. Every. Single. One. One of the ones I missed out on was a shiny Solrock because of it. Restarting the app didn't fix it, logging in and out didn't fix it, and it ended up just passing after 45ish minutes. I dropped the issue because while I would have loved to add another shiny to the collection, it wasn't the end of the world for a Solrock. Fast forward to my EX-raid today where I fought and beat Deoxys and was trying to catch it. I hit it with probably 80% of my balls, at least half of those were greats or excellents. Every single ball would not even finish the first shake, then it would break out. I would understand if this were a tougher legendary, but with Deoxys's catch rate, I find this unlikely. #8203; Anyone else have this problem? Should I contact support? I doubt they would just gift me a Deoxys.

I am currently pro-vaccine but am dating someone who is anti-vaccine (she was raised to be). If I were to tell you to convince me to be pro-common sense like you say you are, please argue the points brought up by the person you are debating. I am genuinely curious as I have done a lot of research myself for the benefit of my loved ones, and have invited all of them to present me with proof or evidence of their claims, to which they call me sheep as well, and refuse to provide any sort of evidence. I am not kidding when I say I need proof of claims and am open minded. Like I'm practically begging for proof. So, please provide it. I want a fair assessment of both sides of the coin.

Working in the medical field (RN, not MD), I can say that ALMOST all (I'd be lying if I said the old fashioned doctors do) doctors that I have worked with have done extensive research on their own regarding vaccines because of (instagram posts? Really?) posts like this and continuous accusations of not knowing enough about vaccines due to not being taught in school. You don't need to learn everything in school to do your own independent research. You do however, need to be educated and understand how disease, medications, physiology, etc, work before jumping into scientific articles that discuss these very topics and the effects (or lack of) that vaccines play. Doctors go through extensive education in these topics, and from there, are able to do their own independent research on vaccines as a result. If anything, nursing school taught me how to look for evidence-based research and to sort through articles. I dont want to be encouraging harmful medications to my patients, and the doctors I know are even better at it due to their increased responsibility and liability for ordering medications, as well as the fact that they need to be constantly updating themselves on the latest medical practices to find the best ways to treat their patients.
Can you link said evidence please?:)

First off, please at least wait until we can adequately test en masse. I understand that the economy needs to reopen or else everything will go bankrupt and homelessness will increase and everything. I work as an RN so I think I can answer this one. I live in San Diego. Currently, my hospital tests everyone that is admitted, regardless of whether or not they are presenting with covid symptoms (one is a nadopharyngeal test, the one where they look like they're shoving the q-tip to your brain which is used for symptomatic patients, and then nasal swabs which go to about the nose bone and that's it). At the start of the pandemic, for the entirety of March, we had 12 test kits total. Were the biggest hospital in the area, and we had 12 test kits. The people who were getting those kits I can guarantee are people that have for sure covid due to severe symptoms, they just need the confirmation from the test to start treating them as such. Same goes for new york. You guys were hit hard early, before tests were more widely available. Your hospitals tested the people that they were 90% sure had covid due to more severe symptoms while turning everyone else away. You guys also got the first surge of tests because of how early you were hit and the sudden spike of deaths in the state. But even with that, due to the huge population of new york, your hospitals could still only test people they were sure had covid, so you saw an increase in cases due to the number of tests you guys got, but the big majority of people that were being tested had more severe symptoms and more likely had a poor prognosis. Theres also that huge nursing home issue that Cuomo did (I'm a Democrat and I think that was the dumbest thing anyone could have done btw), which I'm sure surged cases and deaths even more.

WRITING.TITLE: Number of deaths involving coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), pneumonia, and infuenza in the U.S. from February 1 to June 27, 2020

WRITING.TEXT: I am posting this here for a discussion and to bring forth some statistics about the pandemic. This is not a #8220;CORONAVIRUS HAS THIS MANY DEATHS AND ORANGE MAN BAD BECAUSE LOOK AT DEATHS #8221;. I don #8217;t even want this to really be political, other than the fact that the vast majority of people who don #8217;t think the virus is #8220;that bad #8221; based on the national death rate, or wearing masks happen to be conservative. I understand not all conservatives believe in this either, so to those of you who also believe in social distancing and masks and everything, this post is not directed to you. I am posting this as a discussion for people who don #8217;t believe the coronavirus is #8220;that bad #8221;, I would just like your point of view. Among both conservative and democratic sites, this is the most open-minded place that I see, so I would like to talk about it. #8203; I #8217;ve done some research, I #8217;ve seen the posts about over-reporting cases/deaths in blue states, as well as underreporting in red states. So I present this graph to you asking you to please, DO NOT LOOK AT ANYTHING COVID RELATED as it has shown that both red and blue states are inaccurate in these counts, so official numbers mean nothing. Take a look at the pneumonia deaths. It #8217;s usually pretty clear cut if someone dies of pneumonia, the tests for those are pretty easy to do and to diagnose, so I want to go based off of those. #8203; Based on this chart, from February 1st to June 27th of this year, there were 123,177 deaths in the United States where the primary cause of death was reported as pneumonia. Also based on the chart, this count is separate from anything COVID or influenza related. This does not list anything about comorbidities associated with it in any way, extra data, This is strictly deaths where pneumonia was identified as the primary cause of death. #8203; I wish I had a state breakdown but I had looked and this was the best graphic I could find in general. And if anything, that would cause finger-pointing towards certain states and politicians, and that is not the type of discussion I think would be helpful. #8203; Now take a look at this chart: [https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/pressroom/sosmap/flu\_pneumonia\_mortality/flu\_pneumonia.htm](https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/pressroom/sosmap/flu_pneumonia_mortality/flu_pneumonia.htm)[https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/pressroom/sosmap/flu\_pneumonia\_mortality/flu\_pneumonia.htm](https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/pressroom/sosmap/flu_pneumonia_mortality/flu_pneumonia.htm) #8203; Unfortunately, the most recent chart that I could find only dates to 2018 and prior, so it #8217;s not exactly the most #8220;up to date #8221;, but if you look through each year, it breaks down the number of deaths of pneumonia AND influenza (also could not find one that separates the two, so please share if you do have one). There is a general trend that you can follow if you add everything up per year. #8203; I personally added everything up between 2016-2018, and what I got was: Entire year of 2016: 51,459 deaths in the US of Pneumonia AND Influenza Entire year of 2017: 55,593 deaths in the US of Pneumonia AND Influenza Entire year of 2018: 57,621 deaths in the US of Pneumonia AND Influenza #8203; And then repeating the number associated it with the chart in the title: February 1st to June 27th of 2020: 123,177 deaths in the US of ONLY Pneumonia #8203; While the rate of pneumonia deaths increases every year, it is only by a few thousand (I can go back a few years more if requested, but for now, meh, it #8217;s all much less than 10,000 deaths difference per year). Then you get to a couple months this year, and the number more than doubles. From the original graph, this group is entirely different than the 112,700 deaths where COVID was listed as the primary cause. Following this pattern, let #8217;s guess/assume that somewhere between 60-65k died of pneumonia in 2019, making it we #8217;ll say 70-75k pneumonia deaths total this year to play it safe, but that is being extremely generous based on the trend. That still leaves roughly 48-53k worth of pneumonia deaths that seemed to have popped up out of nowhere. Remember that these numbers are in the span of a couple months. #8203; As is well known, a common cause of death from COVID is pneumonia which are the numbers I am trying to show here. While there are other known/suspected causes of COVID deaths, such as cytokine storms, blood clots, organ failure (caused by cytokine storms sometimes), etc, I am only showing pneumonia cases to keep it a simple and linear discussion. #8203; So to repeat what I was saying at the beginning, for those of you who do not believe this virus is #8220;that bad #8221;, or not worth stressing over/protecting yourself against, why do you believe this? I do not want hyperbolic answers as those don #8217;t help here (I #8217;m an RN so I see a lot of sick COVID patients, but I #8217;m not saying that makes me have more or less #8220;qualified #8221; hyperbolic instances than you, I am simply stating that just because something doesn #8217;t apply to you doesn #8217;t mean the world around you isn #8217;t on fire). #8203; Thanks! I hope I #8217;m not downvoted a ton as I just want discussion. I can also provide more sources if you #8217;d like, but these were the best I could find at the moment. #8203; TL;DR #8203; People who don #8217;t believe the virus is that bad, as a well-known cause of COVID related deaths, pneumonia deaths in 2 months are more than double that of previous years, and that #8217;s not including other known COVID-related causes of death. That is also completely disregarding the official reported number of COVID deaths since we know those numbers are unreliable. And please no finger-pointing. #8203; Thanks!

It goes away instantly afterwards as if it never happened. It has been getting slightly more intense lately with a little bit of pain associated with it, and im worried that itll blow or something which would put me out of work for a while and seriously dampen my plans on getting engaged and moving this upcoming year. So some background info: 26 y/o male, 6'2" 245 lbs. RN so im on my feet a lot, but pretty inactive outside of work My car is a honda accord, so pretty low to the ground. When getting out, think tall person trying to stand up from a low toilet with the left leg first. I park on the street on a pretty steep incline facing up. So when i am standing up completely and the pulling sensation hits, my right leg is going up the slope and left leg is going downwards. This sensation does not happen when walking, running, getting up from any other position, or even while doing squats. Medications: Atorvastatin, Intuniv, Lamictal, rare Adderall on nights im assigned to give chemo (probs once or twice a month tops) Any advice or help would be greatly appreciated.
